pageContext.description: Dimensions: L 144mm; We 82.6mm; Wbt. 27.7mm; Mth 11.8mm; Tbt 2.2mm,Typology: no defined e. bev. survives but suggestion of original one with recurved ends; no flanges - one or two hums along edge may result from differential corr.,Manufacture: v. a sym. cross-section of sides from open mould - sides also retain weak double facet with more steeply angled one converging before reaching butt and blade tip.,Condition: edge chocolate brown - recent blunting/rubbing; part of butt chocolate brown - recent blunting/rubbing; otherwise probably near intact
pageContext.surface: Dark green surface, with little lighter mottling - all rough with pock scars
pageContext.collection: Peterborough Museum 4/1977,acquired from Mr. A.R. Bell, 84 Western Avenue, Peterborough
pageContext.site: England, lincolnshire,north kyme,near st. luke's church,found in "a field at rear of st. luke's church", north kyme, by mr. a. r. bell, 84 western avenue, presumably recently in 1977.
pageContext.remarks: Archive: PIF,PRBAF: SI,Ext. CI,Rec. SN Aug 81,Source: MU
